meanings.definition: Pekes: plural form of peke, a small dog breed
meanings.sent1: I saw a group of pekes playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: The pekes barked happily as their owner arrived home.
meanings.sent3: The pekes had a funny habit of chasing their tails in circles.
meanings.sent4: The pekes' fluffy fur reminded me of cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The pekes' small size made them perfect lap dogs.

meanings.definition: Pekes: third person singular present of peke, to look quickly or furtively at something
meanings.sent1: She pekes around the corner to see if anyone is coming.
meanings.sent2: He always pekes out the window when he hears a noise outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat pekes at the birds from behind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The detective pekes through the keyhole to gather clues.
meanings.sent5: The child pekes under the bed to find his lost toy.
